column4: why is the 64bit ubuntu iso called amd64? is AMD the only company that makes 64bit cpus?
they defined the first 64 bit architecture
thanks...i have a Intel Core 2 Quad CPU    Q9550.....is that 64bit?
yes thats 64 bit
but 32 bit applications generally work better unless you need precision computing
I have 64bit and everything works
wait...did you install 64bit or are you making the case it is better to install 32bit ubuntu on a 64bit cpu?

kindof both. I installed 64 bit and 2 years ago it took me a while to get things to work. Now i reinstalled 64bit and it worked fine too. what I am saying is that you should get both types of applications for things that like hardware
thanks
is 64bit FASTER? there must be some advantage otherwise why not just put the more reliable 32bit ubuntu on your machine?
no its not faster
*sigh*..then what is the point?
it depends on your memory
there is only so much room for memory adresses in 32 bits of space
really? i just got 32bit all nice and i'm not sure if i should REINSTALL w/ 64bit ubuntu
how much memory do you have
4 gigs
32 bit is fine then
the speedups are SOOOO small you would not notice them. they are around 8%
gordonjcp: thank you very much for the help
no problem you know we love you
